definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: Bring the photo to the light so we can see it better.
sentences.chinese: 你把相片拿到明處來，讓大家看個清楚。

sentences.english: What I tell you in the dark, speak in the daylight;
sentences.chinese: 我在暗中告訴你們的，你們要在明處說出來。

sentences.english: In the dark, speak in the daylight.
sentences.chinese: 暗中告訴你們的，你們要在明處說出來。

sentences.english: Mr Think the guerrillas in the dark, the Japanese, in the light is better.
sentences.chinese: 金戈認爲過去游擊隊在暗處，日軍在明處，比較好打。

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
